title: Battle of Marathon: The conventionally accepted date for the Battle of Marathon. The Athenians and their Plataean allies, defeat the first Persian invasion force of Greece.
text: Battle of Marathon: The conventionally accepted date for the Battle of Marathon. The Athenians and their Plataean allies, defeat the first Persian invasion force of Greece.

title: Sixteen Kingdoms: Jin Xiaowudi, age 10, succeeds his father Jin Jianwendi as Emperor of the Eastern Jin dynasty.
text: Sixteen Kingdoms: Jin Xiaowudi, age 10, succeeds his father Jin Jianwendi as Emperor of the Eastern Jin dynasty.

title: Emperor Andronikos I Komnenos brutally put to death in Constantinople.
text: Emperor Andronikos I Komnenos brutally put to death in Constantinople.

title: Albigensian Crusade: Simon de Montfort, 5th Earl of Leicester, defeats Peter II of Aragon at the Battle of Muret.
text: Albigensian Crusade: Simon de Montfort, 5th Earl of Leicester, defeats Peter II of Aragon at the Battle of Muret.

title: Battle of Portopí: The Aragonese army under the command of James I of Aragon disembarks at Santa Ponça, Majorca, with the purpose of conquering the island.
text: Battle of Portopí: The Aragonese army under the command of James I of Aragon disembarks at Santa Ponça, Majorca, with the purpose of conquering the island.

title: The First Siege of Gibraltar takes place in the context of the Spanish Reconquista pitting the forces of the Kingdom of Castile against the Emirate of Granada resulting in a Castilian victory.
text: The First Siege of Gibraltar takes place in the context of the Spanish Reconquista pitting the forces of the Kingdom of Castile against the Emirate of Granada resulting in a Castilian victory.

title: Henry Hudson begins his exploration of the Hudson River while aboard the Halve Maen.
text: Henry Hudson begins his exploration of the Hudson River while aboard the Halve Maen.

title: A gunpowder factory explodes in Valletta, Malta, killing 22 people and damaging several buildings.
text: A gunpowder factory explodes in Valletta, Malta, killing 22 people and damaging several buildings.

title: Austro-Ottoman War: Battle of Vienna: Several European armies join forces to defeat the Ottoman Empire.
text: Austro-Ottoman War: Battle of Vienna: Several European armies join forces to defeat the Ottoman Empire.

title: Battle of North Point: an American detachment halts the British land advance to Baltimore in the War of 1812.
text: Battle of North Point: an American detachment halts the British land advance to Baltimore in the War of 1812.

title: Elizabeth Barrett elopes with Robert Browning.
text: Elizabeth Barrett elopes with Robert Browning.

title: Mexican–American War: the Battle of Chapultepec begins.
text: Mexican–American War: the Battle of Chapultepec begins.

title: Switzerland approves its 1st Constitution and becomes a Federal state.
text: Switzerland approves its 1st Constitution and becomes a Federal state.

title: The SS Central America sinks about 160 miles east of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina, drowning a total of 426 passengers and crew, including Captain William Lewis Herndon. The ship was carrying 13–15 tons of gold from the California Gold Rush.
text: The SS Central America sinks about 160 miles east of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina, drowning a total of 426 passengers and crew, including Captain William Lewis Herndon. The ship was carrying 13–15 tons of gold from the California Gold Rush.

title: Arbroath 36–0 Bon Accord, a world record scoreline in professional Association football.
text: Arbroath 36–0 Bon Accord, a world record scoreline in professional Association football.

title: Salisbury, Rhodesia, is founded.
text: Salisbury, Rhodesia, is founded.

title: Tirah Campaign: Battle of Saragarhi.
text: Tirah Campaign: Battle of Saragarhi.

title: The Newport Transporter Bridge is opened in Newport, South Wales by Viscount Tredegar.
text: The Newport Transporter Bridge is opened in Newport, South Wales by Viscount Tredegar.

title: Premiere performance of Gustav Mahler's Symphony No. 8 in Munich (with a chorus of 852 singers and an orchestra of 171 players. Mahler's rehearsal assistant conductor was Bruno Walter)
text: Premiere performance of Gustav Mahler's Symphony No. 8 in Munich (with a chorus of 852 singers and an orchestra of 171 players. Mahler's rehearsal assistant conductor was Bruno Walter)

title: French soldiers rescue over 4,000 Armenian Genocide survivors stranded on Musa Dagh.
text: French soldiers rescue over 4,000 Armenian Genocide survivors stranded on Musa Dagh.

title: Adolf Hitler joins the German Workers' Party (later the Nazi Party).
text: Adolf Hitler joins the German Workers' Party (later the Nazi Party).

title: Southern Rhodesia, today called Zimbabwe, is annexed by the United Kingdom.
text: Southern Rhodesia, today called Zimbabwe, is annexed by the United Kingdom.

title: Leó Szilárd, waiting for a red light on Southampton Row in Bloomsbury, conceives the idea of the nuclear chain reaction.
text: Leó Szilárd, waiting for a red light on Southampton Row in Bloomsbury, conceives the idea of the nuclear chain reaction.

title: Adolf Hitler demands autonomy and self-determination for the Germans of the Sudetenland region of Czechoslovakia.
text: Adolf Hitler demands autonomy and self-determination for the Germans of the Sudetenland region of Czechoslovakia.

title: Cave paintings are discovered in Lascaux, France.
text: Cave paintings are discovered in Lascaux, France.

title: An explosion at the Hercules Powder Company plant in Kenvil, New Jersey kills 51 people and injures over 200.
text: An explosion at the Hercules Powder Company plant in Kenvil, New Jersey kills 51 people and injures over 200.

title: World War II: RMS Laconia, carrying civilians, Allied soldiers and Italian POWs is torpedoed off the coast of West Africa and sinks with a heavy loss of life.
text: World War II: RMS Laconia, carrying civilians, Allied soldiers and Italian POWs is torpedoed off the coast of West Africa and sinks with a heavy loss of life.

title: World War II: First day of the Battle of Edson's Ridge during the Guadalcanal Campaign. U.S. Marines protecting Henderson Field on Guadalcanal are attacked by Imperial Japanese Army forces.
text: World War II: First day of the Battle of Edson's Ridge during the Guadalcanal Campaign. U.S. Marines protecting Henderson Field on Guadalcanal are attacked by Imperial Japanese Army forces.

title: World War II: Benito Mussolini, dictator of Italy, is rescued from house arrest on the Gran Sasso in Abruzzi, by German commando forces led by Otto Skorzeny.
text: World War II: Benito Mussolini, dictator of Italy, is rescued from house arrest on the Gran Sasso in Abruzzi, by German commando forces led by Otto Skorzeny.

title: World War II: The liberation of Serbia from Nazi Germany continues. Bajina Bašta in western Serbia is among the liberated cities.
text: World War II: The liberation of Serbia from Nazi Germany continues. Bajina Bašta in western Serbia is among the liberated cities.

title: Strange occurrences, including a monster sighting, take place in Flatwoods, West Virginia.
text: Strange occurrences, including a monster sighting, take place in Flatwoods, West Virginia.

title: U.S. Senator and future President John Fitzgerald Kennedy marries Jacqueline Lee Bouvier at St. Mary's Church in Newport, Rhode Island.
text: U.S. Senator and future President John Fitzgerald Kennedy marries Jacqueline Lee Bouvier at St. Mary's Church in Newport, Rhode Island.

title: Jack Kilby demonstrates the first working integrated circuit while working at Texas Instruments.
text: Jack Kilby demonstrates the first working integrated circuit while working at Texas Instruments.

title: The Soviet Union launches a large rocket, Lunik II, at the moon.
text: The Soviet Union launches a large rocket, Lunik II, at the moon.

title: Bonanza premieres, the first regularly scheduled TV program presented in color.
text: Bonanza premieres, the first regularly scheduled TV program presented in color.

title: The African and Malagasy Union is founded.
text: The African and Malagasy Union is founded.

title: President John F. Kennedy, at a speech at Rice University, reaffirms that the U.S. will put a man on the moon by the end of the decade.
text: President John F. Kennedy, at a speech at Rice University, reaffirms that the U.S. will put a man on the moon by the end of the decade.

title: Gemini 11, the penultimate mission of NASA's Gemini program, and the current human altitude record holder (except for the Apollo lunar missions)
text: Gemini 11, the penultimate mission of NASA's Gemini program, and the current human altitude record holder (except for the Apollo lunar missions)

title: Dawson's Field hijackings: Palestinian terrorists blow up three hijacked airliners in Jordan, continuing to hold the passengers hostage in various undisclosed locations in Amman.
text: Dawson's Field hijackings: Palestinian terrorists blow up three hijacked airliners in Jordan, continuing to hold the passengers hostage in various undisclosed locations in Amman.

title: Emperor Haile Selassie of Ethiopia, 'Messiah' of the Rastafari movement, is deposed following a military coup by the Derg, ending a reign of 58 years.
text: Emperor Haile Selassie of Ethiopia, 'Messiah' of the Rastafari movement, is deposed following a military coup by the Derg, ending a reign of 58 years.

title: Juventude Africana Amílcar Cabral is founded in Guinea-Bissau.
text: Juventude Africana Amílcar Cabral is founded in Guinea-Bissau.

title: South African anti-apartheid activist Steve Biko dies in police custody.
text: South African anti-apartheid activist Steve Biko dies in police custody.

title: Military coup in Turkey.
text: Military coup in Turkey.

title: A Wells Fargo depot in West Hartford, Connecticut, United States, is robbed of approximately US$7 million by Los Macheteros.
text: A Wells Fargo depot in West Hartford, Connecticut, United States, is robbed of approximately US$7 million by Los Macheteros.

title: The USSR vetoes a United Nations Security Council Resolution deploring the Soviet destruction of Korean Air Lines Flight 007.
text: The USSR vetoes a United Nations Security Council Resolution deploring the Soviet destruction of Korean Air Lines Flight 007.

title: Dwight Gooden sets the baseball record for strikeouts in a season by a rookie with 246, previously set by Herb Score in 1954. Gooden's 276 strikeouts that season, pitched in 218 innings, set the current record.
text: Dwight Gooden sets the baseball record for strikeouts in a season by a rookie with 246, previously set by Herb Score in 1954. Gooden's 276 strikeouts that season, pitched in 218 innings, set the current record.

title: Hurricane Gilbert devastates Jamaica; it turns towards Mexico's Yucatán Peninsula two days later, causing an estimated $5 billion in damage.
text: Hurricane Gilbert devastates Jamaica; it turns towards Mexico's Yucatán Peninsula two days later, causing an estimated $5 billion in damage.

title: The two German states and the Four Powers sign the Treaty on the Final Settlement with Respect to Germany in Moscow, paving the way for German reunification.
text: The two German states and the Four Powers sign the Treaty on the Final Settlement with Respect to Germany in Moscow, paving the way for German reunification.

title: NASA launches Space Shuttle Endeavour on STS-47 which marked the 50th shuttle mission. On board are Mae Carol Jemison, the first African-American woman in space, Mamoru Mohri, the first Japanese citizen to fly in a US spaceship, and Mark Lee and Jan Davis, the first married couple in space.
text: NASA launches Space Shuttle Endeavour on STS-47 which marked the 50th shuttle mission. On board are Mae Carol Jemison, the first African-American woman in space, Mamoru Mohri, the first Japanese citizen to fly in a US spaceship, and Mark Lee and Jan Davis, the first married couple in space.

title: Abimael Guzmán, leader of the Shining Path, is captured by Peruvian special forces; shortly thereafter the rest of Shining Path's leadership fell as well.
text: Abimael Guzmán, leader of the Shining Path, is captured by Peruvian special forces; shortly thereafter the rest of Shining Path's leadership fell as well.

title: Frank Eugene Corder fatally crashes a single-engine Cessna 150 into the White House's south lawn, striking the West wing. There were no other casualties.
text: Frank Eugene Corder fatally crashes a single-engine Cessna 150 into the White House's south lawn, striking the West wing. There were no other casualties.

title: Ansett Australia, Australia's first commercial interstate airline, collapses due to increased strain on the international airline industry, leaving 10,000 people unemployed.
text: Ansett Australia, Australia's first commercial interstate airline, collapses due to increased strain on the international airline industry, leaving 10,000 people unemployed.

title: The United Nations lifts sanctions against Libya after that country agreed to accept responsibility and recompense the families of victims in the 1988 bombing of Pan Am Flight 103.
text: The United Nations lifts sanctions against Libya after that country agreed to accept responsibility and recompense the families of victims in the 1988 bombing of Pan Am Flight 103.

title: Iraq War: In Fallujah, U.S. forces mistakenly shoot and kill eight Iraqi police officers.

title: The 2008 Chatsworth train collision in Los Angeles between a Metrolink commuter train and a Union Pacific freight train kills 25 people.

title: The National September 11 Memorial & Museum in New York City opens to the public.
